Detailed Description

Module to control the channel and handle all connection related stuff.

The central module that coordinates the connections between all nodes, and handles dynamic gate creation. BasicConnectionManager therefore periodically communicates with the ChannelAccess modules

You may not instantiate BasicConnectionManager! Use ConnectionManager instead.

Author:
Steffen Sroka, Daniel Willkomm, Karl Wessel
See also:
ChannelAccess

Definition at line 23 of file BaseConnectionManager.h.

00047     //step 1 - calculate dimension of grid
00048     //one cell should have the size of maxInterferenceDistance
00049     Coord dim((*playgroundSize) / maxInterferenceDistance + Coord(1.0, 1.0, 1.0));
00050 
00051     gridDim = GridCoord(dim);

00056     if((gridDim.x <= 3) && (gridDim.y <= 3) && (gridDim.z <= 3))

00058       gridDim.x = 1;
00059       gridDim.y = 1;
00060       gridDim.z = 1;
00061     }
00062 
00063     //step 2 - initialize the matrix which represents our grid
00064     NicEntries entries;
00065     RowVector row;
00066     NicMatrix matrix;
00067 
00068     for (int i = 0; i < gridDim.z; ++i) {
00069       row.push_back(entries);         //copy empty NicEntries to RowVector
00070     }
00071     for (int i = 0; i < gridDim.y; ++i) { //fill the ColVector with copies of
00072       matrix.push_back(row);          //the RowVector.
00073     }
00074     for (int i = 0; i < gridDim.x; ++i) { //fill the grid with copies of
00075       nicGrid.push_back(matrix);        //the matrix.
00076     }
00077     ccEV << " using " << gridDim.x << "x" <<
00078                gridDim.y << "x" <<
00079                gridDim.z << " grid" << endl;
00080 
00081     //step 3 -  calculate the factor which maps the coordinate of a node
00082     //      to the grid cell
00083 
00084     if (gridDim.x == 1 &&                       //if we use a 1x1 grid
00085       gridDim.y == 1 &&                       //every coordinate is
00086       gridDim.z == 1) {                       //mapped to (1,1, 1)
00087       findDistance = FWMath::max(playgroundSize->getX(),        //so the factor is the
00088                      FWMath::max(playgroundSize->getY(),  //largest number a
00089                            playgroundSize->getZ())) //coordinate can get (+1)
00090                + 1.0;
00091     } else {
00092       findDistance = ceil(maxInterferenceDistance);   //otherwise the factor is our
00093       if(findDistance == maxInterferenceDistance)     //maxInterferenceDistance
00094         findDistance += EPSILON;                  //plus a small epsilon
00095     }
00096     ccEV << "findDistance is " << findDistance << endl;

If you want to do your own stuff at the registration of a nic see "registerNicExt()".

void BaseConnectionManager::registerNicExt ( int  nicID  )  [protected, virtual]

Called by "registerNic()" after the nic has been registered. That means that the NicEntry for the nic has already been created and added to nics map.

You better know what you are doing if you want to override this method. Most time you won't need to.

See ConnectionManager::registerNicExt() for an example.

Parameters:
nicID - the id of the NicEntry

void BaseConnectionManager::updateConnections ( int  nicID,
const Coord *  oldPos,
const Coord *  newPos 
) [protected, virtual]

Updates the connections of the nic with "nicID".

This method is called by "updateNicPos()" after the new Position is stored in the corresponding nic.

Most time you won't need to override this method.

Parameters:
nicID the id of the NicEntry
oldPos the old position of the nic
newPos the new position of the nic

int BaseConnectionManager::wrapIfTorus ( int  value,
int  max 
) [private]

If the value is outside of its bounds (zero and max) this function returns -1 if useTorus is false and the wrapped value if useTorus is true. Otherwise its just returns the value unchanged.

Definition at line 171 of file BaseConnectionManager.cc.

Referenced by fillUnionWithNeighbors().

00180       return value - max;
00181     } else {
00182       return -1;
00183     }
00184   } else {
00185     return value;

double BaseConnectionManager::findDistance [protected]

Distance that helps to find a node under a certain position.

Can be larger then

See also:
maxInterferenceDistance to allow nodes to be placed into the same square if the playground is too small for the grid speedup to work.

NicCube BaseConnectionManager::nicGrid [protected]

Registry of all nics.

This matrix keeps all nics according to their position. It allows to restrict the position update to a subset of all nics.
